title: How to Find and Match with Small Influencers for PR Packages (Step-by-Step)
excerpt: A step-by-step guide for brands on how to find, vet, and match with the perfect small influencers for your PR packages. Learn the manual way, then see the platform that automates it.
content:
Your Complete Guide to Finding and Matching with Small Influencers in 2025

You've seen the data. You know that partnering with high-engagement small influencers is the key to PR success. But how do you find them? Manually scrolling through thousands of hashtags and paying for clunky 'influencer discovery tools' is slow and expensive. This guide provides a 5-step framework for finding and matching with the perfect creators for your brand, and then shows you how to automate the entire process. Join Newcollab to connect with thousands of vetted small influencers ready for your brand.

The Ultimate Influencer Matching System

Stop hunting. Newcollab is the PR platform for brands that flips the script. Creators post their creative ideas, and you bid on the projects that perfectly match your campaign.

Find Your Perfect Match

ðŸ“‹Table of Contents

1. Define Your Target Audience
2. Find Creators in Your Niche
3. Review Engagement Rates & Authenticity
4. Send PR Package (The Pitch)
5. Track Your Results
6. The Newcollab Solution
7. Advanced Matching Strategies
8. Common Mistakes to Avoid
9. Building Your Influencer Network
10. Measuring Match Quality
11. Why Choose Newcollab
12. Conclusion

Step 1: Define Your Target Audience & Creator Persona

Before you look for an influencer, you must know your customer. You are not trying to find a creator; you are trying to find their audience. Get specific:

  • Audience Demo: 25-35 year old urban professional.
  • Audience Interest: Sustainable fashion, productivity hacks, specialty coffee.
  • Creator Persona: A creator whose content is polished, informative, and authentic, and whose audience matches your customer.
  • Geographic Location: Are you targeting specific regions or global audiences?
  • Platform Preferences: Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, or multi-platform creators?

This foundation ensures every creator you find will have an audience that aligns with your brand's target customer.

Step 2: Find Creators in Your Niche (The Manual Hunt)

This is the most time-consuming part. Use these tactics to build a long list of potential partners:

  • Hashtag Research: Go beyond #influencer. Search for hyper-niche hashtags like #minimaliststyle, #cleanskincare, or #aussiecreators.
  • Competitor Analysis: Look at your competitors' tagged posts. Who is tagging them? Who are they featuring?
  • 'Lookalike' Audiences: Find one creator who is a perfect fit, then look at who they follow and collaborate with.
  • Platform Search: Use Instagram's search, TikTok's discovery, and YouTube's search to find creators in your niche
  • Community Engagement: Look for active creators in relevant Facebook groups, Reddit communities, and Discord servers

This manual process can take hours per creator. Using Newcollab eliminates this step entirely.

Step 3: Review Engagement Rates & Authenticity (The Vetting)

A high follower count is a vanity metric. Engagement is what matters. Manually review your list:

  • Calculate Engagement Rate: (Likes + Comments) / Followers Ã— 100. Look for 3-6% or higher.
  • Read the Comments: Are they from real fans or just 'Great post!' from other creators? You want to see genuine conversation.
  • Check for Value Alignment: Does this creator's personal brand and values align with your own?
  • Review Content Quality: Is their content consistent, professional, and on-brand?
  • Check Activity Level: Are they posting regularly or have they gone inactive?

This vetting process is time-intensive but critical. Newcollab pre-vets all creators, saving you this step.

Step 4: Send the PR Package (The Pitch)

Now you have to start the cold outreach. This involves finding their email, sending a personalized pitch, and following up (and following up again). For a full breakdown, use our 5 Copy-Paste Email Pitch Templates.

Key elements of a successful pitch:

  • Personalization: Reference specific content that shows you've done your research
  • Clear Value Proposition: Explain why this partnership benefits them
  • Specific Ask: Be clear about what you're requesting (e.g., 'one Instagram post featuring our product')
  • Follow-Up Strategy: Plan for 2-3 follow-ups if you don't hear back

This outreach process can take days or weeks per creator. With Newcollab, creators come to you with ready ideas.

Step 5: Track Your Results

Don't just send and pray. You must track your ROI. Did the creator post? What was the engagement? How much traffic did it drive? (Pro Tip: Use a trackable UTM link or a unique discount code). For more, read our PR Package ROI Calculator.

Essential tracking metrics:

  • Content Delivery: Did the creator post as agreed?
  • Engagement Metrics: Likes, comments, shares, and saves
    • Traffic & Conversions: Clicks from UTM links or discount codes
  • Content Quality: Is the content repurposable for your marketing?
  • Long-Term Value: Did this lead to repeat collaborations?

Tracking manually across multiple creators is complex. Newcollab provides built-in tracking tools.

'The 5-step manual process took my intern a full week just to find 10 qualified creators. It's a logistical nightmare. With Newcollab, we found 20 perfect matches in one afternoon.'

- E-commerce Brand Manager

The Newcollab Solution: The Ultimate 'Matching System'

The manual process is slow, expensive, and scales poorly. Newcollab is the PR platform for brands built to solve this. We are not another static 'influencer discovery tool' database you have to search.

Newcollab is a live marketplace of ideas.

  1. Creators post their creative project ideas (e.g., 'My Apartment Makeover ft. Sustainable Decor').
  2. You browse these active, pre-vetted projects from thousands of creators.
  3. You find a project that perfectly matches your brand and audience.
  4. You place a bid.

You completely skip Steps 2, 3, and 4. You are no longer 'finding' influencers; you are 'matching' with motivated creators who already have a perfect, brand-safe idea. It's the fastest way to go from idea to execution.

Join Newcollab to start matching with creators today.

Advanced Matching Strategies

Once you understand the basics, use these advanced strategies to find even better matches:

  • Content Analysis: Review past content to ensure style and quality align with your brand
  • Audience Overlap: Find creators whose audiences overlap with your existing customers
  • Engagement Quality: Look for creators whose comments show genuine interest and purchase intent
  • Multi-Platform Presence: Consider creators active on multiple platforms for broader reach
  • Seasonal Timing: Match with creators who create content relevant to your product's season

Newcollab's platform makes these advanced matching strategies easy with built-in filters and analytics.

Common Mistakes to Avoid

Common pitfalls that derail influencer matching:

  • Focusing on Follower Count: Prioritizing reach over engagement leads to poor ROI
  • Ignoring Audience Demographics: Not verifying that the creator's audience matches your target customer
  • Generic Outreach: Sending mass emails gets ignoredâ€”personalization is essential
  • Skipping Vetting: Not checking engagement rates and authenticity before partnering
  • No Clear Brief: Ambiguity leads to content that doesn't meet your expectations
  • Not Tracking Results: Without tracking, you can't optimize or justify future campaigns

Use Newcollab to avoid these mistakes with pre-vetted creators and clear project expectations.

Building Your Influencer Network

Turn one-time PR into a long-term influencer network:

  • Start Small: Test with 10-20 creators first to refine your process
  • Build Relationships: Engage with creators' content regularly, not just when you need something
  • Offer Repeat Opportunities: Move from PR packages to paid partnerships for ongoing collaborations
  • Create a Preferred List: Build a list of proven creators who consistently deliver great results
  • Exclusive Access: Give network creators first access to new products or launches

A strong influencer network reduces discovery costs and improves content quality over time.

Measuring Match Quality

How do you know if you've found a good match?

  • Audience Alignment: Does the creator's audience match your target customer demographics?
  • Engagement Rate: Is their engagement rate above 3% (ideally 5%+)?
  • Content Quality: Does their content style align with your brand aesthetic?
  • Value Alignment: Do their personal values and brand align with yours?
  • Response Rate: Do they respond to messages and engage with their audience?

Track these metrics to build a database of high-quality creator matches over time.

Why Choose Newcollab

Newcollab makes finding and matching with influencers effortless:

  • 10,000+ Vetted Creators: All creators are pre-vetted for engagement and authenticity
  • Marketplace Model: Creators post ideas, you matchâ€”no cold outreach needed
  • Real-Time Stats: See engagement rates, audience demographics, and content quality upfront
  • Streamlined Process: From discovery to tracking, all in one platform
  • Time Savings: Reduce influencer discovery time from weeks to hours

Join Newcollab to start matching with perfect creators today.

Conclusion

The manual 5-step process for finding influencers works, but it's slow, expensive, and doesn't scale. The choice is clear: spend weeks manually hunting for creators, or use Newcollab to match with thousands of vetted creators who are actively posting perfect project ideas for your brand. Stop searching. Start matching.

Stop Searching. Start Matching.

Use Newcollab's unique matching system to find and sponsor perfect creator projects for your PR packages.

testimonials.quote: This guide perfectly explains the manual nightmare we used to live in. We switched to Newcollab to 'match' with ideas, and it cut our campaign launch time from 3 weeks to 3 days.

faq.question: What's the best way to find small influencers for PR?
faq.answer: The manual way is to search niche hashtags and competitors, then vet engagement rates. The fast, efficient way is to use a PR platform for brands like Newcollab, where you can browse creative ideas from vetted small influencers who are actively seeking partnerships. This eliminates the time-consuming discovery and vetting process.

faq.question: What's a good engagement rate for a small influencer?
faq.answer: Look for 3-6% or higher. Anything above 3% is considered good, but a high-quality, niche micro-influencer can often have 8-10% engagement, which is extremely valuable for a brand. Avoid creators with engagement rates below 2%, as this indicates low audience engagement.

faq.question: How is Newcollab different from an influencer discovery tool?
faq.answer: A discovery tool is a static database (like a phone book) that you have to manually search, filter, and then cold-pitch. Newcollab is a live, dynamic marketplace where creators post their actual content ideas. You 'match' with an idea, not just a profile, ensuring the creator is active and motivated. This eliminates cold outreach and vetting time.

faq.question: What's the first step to finding an influencer?
faq.answer: Stop! Don't look for an influencer. First, define your target customer. You must match your customer's demographics and interests to the influencer's audience, not just the influencer's content. Understanding your audience first ensures every creator you find will have an audience that aligns with your brand's target customer.

faq.question: How long does it take to find and match with influencers manually vs. using Newcollab?
faq.answer: Manually, finding 10 qualified creators can take 1-2 weeks of full-time work (research, vetting, outreach). Using Newcollab, you can find and match with 10 perfect creators in under an hour, as creators post their ideas and you simply browse and bid on projects that match your brand. This reduces discovery time by 95%.
